attributes.action: Change the GICs for transgender people, instead make an informed consent model
attributes.additional_details: I want this change since the current system follows old ideology and it’s causing issues such as wait times. The wait times are escalating and the only way to stop this upwards trend is an informed consent model. This will allow the wait times to decrease, a better doctor to patient relationship, and better access to healthcare which is what the NHS is meant to be about. This will because rather than lots of people going to a few locations they will be spread out more.
attributes.background: I want the government to get rid of GICs and instead focus that money on a primary care, informed consent model.

rejection.details:
Decisions about the treatment of patients is a matter for the NHS and individual medical professionals, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following related petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase funding for NHS Transgender Services: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321492

Uphold current legal protections for transgender individuals and under 18s: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318175

Reform the Gender Recognition Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327108
